Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent to which the police opened the gates, as the video footage does not clearly show who exactly "opened" the gates to the federal property.
Understate: The claim may understate the role of the police in allowing rioters to enter the Capitol, as the video footage does show U.S. Capitol police officers slowly walking away from the breached access point without any visible attempt to block the rioters.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the police intentionally opened the gates to allow rioters in, as the video footage does not clearly show who initiated the breach.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the police were complicit in allowing rioters to enter the Capitol, without considering alternative explanations or motives for their actions.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why the police may have appeared to give up on the barricades, such as the overwhelmed nature of the situation or a tactical decision to avoid confrontation.
